title: Ukraine: Elegant Odesa is transformed by efforts to deter Russians
description: As Russian warships circle off the coast, Odesans face a difficult decision on whether to leave.

title: Drive My Car director Hamaguchi: Oscar buzz is beyond imagination
description: Japanese road movie with four Oscar nods puts arthouse director Ryusuke Hamaguchi in the spotlight.

title: Ukraine conflict round-up: Putin's peace demands and a new 'Russian wall'
description: Rescue workers search for survivors of the Mariupol theatre bombing as Russia's advance grinds on.

title: Is the world ready for a great Covid re-opening?
description: We asked our journalists around the world to give us a snapshot of life two years into the pandemic.

title: P&O Ferries: 'We've been abandoned by the company', say sacked staff
description: The decision to immediately sack 800 staff at P&O Ferries sparks angry protests on ship and shore.

title: Ukraine conflict: Putin lays out his demands in Turkish phone call
description: Russia's president revealed his peace conditions in a phone call - the BBC spoke to someone who listened in.

title: Shells rain down on Kharkiv as Ukraine's army stands firm
description: The BBC's Quentin Sommerville and Darren Conway are in Kharkiv, where Ukraine's army has repelled Russia for three weeks.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's release: Learning to live with freedom
description: Experts say it will take time for Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe to readjust to normal life.

title: Quiz of the week: Who made headlines at the Baftas?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Fears Russia will not be able to pay its debts remain
description: Russia may default on its debts as Western sanctions over Ukraine bite.

title: Michael Collins: Lock of Irish leader's hair sells for £18,000
description: It is sold at auction in Belfast for more than double that of a gun he used during a jail break.

title: Marina Ovsyannikova: Protesting journalist says Russians zombified by propaganda
description: Marina Ovsyannikova, who interrupted a broadcast to protest against the war in Ukraine, speaks to the BBC.

title: Mariupol theatre: 'We knew something terrible would happen'
description: A woman who left Mariupol's theatre a day before the bombing says Russia had been targeting the area.

title: P&O cancels services and tells ships to stay in port
description: Ferry operator says it isn't going bust, but a union warns hundreds of staff could be sacked.

title: St Patrick's Day parades: Police warning as public events return
description: Large parades are being held across Northern Ireland on Thursday for the first time in three years.

title: Interest rates rise again to counter higher prices
description: Bank of England increases rates for the third time in four months as the cost of living rises.

title: Scotland coach Townsend drops fly-half Russell for Ireland match
description: Blair Kinghorn starts at number 10, with Finn Russell dropping to the bench, for Scotland's final Six Nations game against Ireland on Saturday.

title: Rethink over crackdown on MPs' second jobs
description: Boris Johnson's call to limit the hours MPs spend on outside work is not practical, a minister says.

title: Who is Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe and why was she jailed in Iran?
description: Why a British-Iranian mother was jailed in Tehran - and why she has been released.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe and Anoosheh Ashoori reunited with their families after years in Iran
description: In emotional scenes, Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe and Anoosheh Ashoori are reunited with their families after years of detention.

title: Kanye West: Rapper suspended from Instagram for 24 hours
description: The rapper used a racial slur in reference to Trevor Noah after the comedian criticised his behaviour.

title: Music experts disagree in Ed Sheeran court case
description: Two music experts offer differing opinions on whether the star copied the work of another writer.

title: Police powers reviewed under racial disparity plan
description: The "Inclusive Britain" plan was developed in response to the Black Lives Matter protests in 2020.

title: How is a UK debt to Iran connected to Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe?
description: The UK has repaid money owed to Iran for a military deal never fulfilled.

title: Former world champion Vettel out of season-opening Bahrain GP with Covid-19
description: Nico Hulkenberg will replace Sebastian Vettel at Aston Martin for the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix on Sunday.

title: Ocado sales hit as workers return to the office
description: The online grocer says its sales have fallen in recent months as people revert to pre-pandemic habits.

title: Inside story of West Ham's turnaround from toxic atmosphere to European glamour nights
description: Beating four-time Europa League winners Sevilla to reach a first European quarter-final since 1981 would be another huge step in David Moyes' plan to build a "new West Ham".

title: 'Dangerous' tanning products promoted by influencers
description: Sprays and injections containing "melanotan-2" may lead to cancer, doctors tell a BBC News investigation.

title: TV classic's radio revival to reveal what Our Friends in the North did next
description: The classic TV drama is adapted for the radio and brought up to date with a new episode set in 2020.

title: Top Boy after George Floyd 'will be eye-opening' for some
description: Actor Ashley Walters says police brutality in the UK is reflected in the fourth series of the Netflix show.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: Why has she been freed now?
description: London-Tehran relations are better, and Iran no longer feels it needs Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe as leverage.

title: Selling sex to survive in Iran
description: Women and men are increasingly turning to prostitution to pay the bills, despite official denials.

title: Ukraine war: Russians grieve for fallen soldiers
description: Two weeks since the last official death toll, funerals of Russian soldiers killed in Ukraine continue.

title: Covid: Why US students are staging walkouts over masks
description: Schools across the US are dropping mask mandates - but students are divided over the issue.

title: MP's message to Nazanin's daughter: 'Mummy really is coming home'
description: MP Tulip Siddiq pays tribute to Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's husband Richard, as she returns from Iran.

title: Travel firms confident they can bounce back in 2022
description: Despite the threat of higher airline ticket prices, the industry is still upbeat as bookings are rising.

title: The Papers: Nazanin free and Russia 'hits theatre holding 1,200'
description: The release of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe leads the papers - along with the continued shelling of the city of Mariupol.

title: In pictures: 2022 Sony World Photography Awards
description: The winners of the Open category of the 2022 Sony World Photography Awards have been announced.

title: Why your fish and chips may cost a lot more
description: The conflict in Ukraine is a long way from the UK but it means fish and chip shops are seeing prices soar.

title: Special access inside Big Ben's newly refurbished clock tower
description: The restoration project of Big Ben is almost over and scaffolding around the clock has been removed.
